data.title: Regent University Online: Online Degree Rankings & Ratings
data.meta_description: See Regent University Online rankings by Salary Score and ratings for online degree programs.
data.text:
Yes, Regent Online is a legitimate university with verifiable accreditation that is nationally recognized and respected. The best way to determine a school’s legitimacy is to determine if it has been accredited. When a school is accredited, its programs have been evaluated to determine that they meet the requirements of delivering a high-level of quality education.

Regent Online is accredited by the Southern Association of Colleges and Schools, Commission on Colleges (SACSOC) to award associate, baccalaureate, master’s, doctorate, and educational specialist degrees. SACSOC is the accrediting agency for degree-granting colleges and universities in the Southern states. In addition, Regent Online has several of its school divisions accredited, like the Accreditation Council for Business Schools and Programs (ACBSP) and The Commission on Accrediting of the Association of Theological Schools in the United States and Canada (ATS).

As an evangelical university, Regent Online is known for its conservative values. For example, it upholds strong policies on drug and alcohol use by banning the substances from their campus. The university’s Standards of Conduct for Students requires students, faculty, staff, and the surrounding community to refrain from using and selling drugs and alcohol on campus. As a dry campus, Regent Online’s students adhere to Christian values by abstaining from these substances.

Regent's bachelor’s degrees that provide the highest earnings for graduates are as follows, alongside median annual earnings: Bachelor of Science in Computer Science ($57,515), Bachelor of Science in Management ($50,374), Bachelor of Science in Professional Studies - Teacher Education ($43,305), Bachelor of Arts in Criminal Justice ($41,600), and Bachelor of Science in Human Resource ManagementHuman Resource Management B.S. Degree | Regent University ($40,046). All of these degrees are available either online or on campus.

According to federal data, Regent’s acceptance rate is 50%, making it more selective than the average among U.S. colleges. Most applicants accepted into Regent have an average SAT score between 500-640 in critical reading and 440-580 in math. Meanwhile, ACTscores ranged between 21 and 29.

To be eligible for admission into Regent Online, prospective students must submit an online application for $50 through the school site. Once the application is submitted, applicants must then complete an admissions questionnaire. Unofficial transcripts are accepted during the admission process, but official transcripts are required before enrollment. Applicants must also submit a government-issued ID and complete a Free Application for Federal Student Aid (FAFSA) to help Regent determine their eligibility for financial student aid. It typically takes a few days to hear back from an admissions counselor about acceptance.
